item.title: EPA Office Complex in Edison, New Jersey to be Powered by Solar Energy
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – January 12, 2017) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency will install a 1.5 megawatt solar panel generation field at the EPA’s Edison, New Jersey facility. Ameresco, Inc.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Seeks Nominations for Environmental Champions
item.description: (New York, NY – December 13, 2016) Each year, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency recognizes and honors environmental trailblazers – individuals, businesses and organizations that have contributed significantly to improving the environment and protecting public health.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Funds Projects to Support Water Conservation and Prevent Chemical Pollution from New Jersey Businesses During Flooding
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – December 5, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has awarded $399,358 to organizations in New Jersey to fund projects that will help businesses reduce chemical pollution and conserve water.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Secures $5.6 Million Worth of Cleanup for Shieldalloy Superfund Site in Newfield and Vineland, N.J.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: Chemical Importer in Saddle Brook, New Jersey Settles Chemical Reporting Case with EPA
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Provides Funding to Protect and Restore Urban Waters
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – Oct. 11, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency is providing grants to two organizations to help protect and restore urban waters in New Jersey and New York.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Secures $165 Million Agreement with Occidental Chemical to Conduct the Work Needed to Start the Cleanup of the Lower Eight Miles of the Passaic River
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Finalizes $11 Million Cleanup Plan for the Standard Chlorine Chemical Site in the Meadowlands on the Hackensack River
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – Oct. 4, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has finalized a plan to clean up contamination at the Standard Chlorine Chemical Company, Inc. Superfund site in Kearny, N.J. The site is part of the N.J. Meadowlands and located on the banks of the Hackensack River.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Finalizes Multi-Million Dollar Cleanup Plan for Warren County, N.J. Superfund Site
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – Sept. 30, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has finalized a plan to remove chemicals from soil at the former American National Can facility in Washington Township, N.J. as part of the ongoing cleanup of the Pohatcong Valley Groundwater Contamination Superfund site.
item.dc:creator: Region 02

item.title: EPA Finalizes $15 Million Additional Cleanup at former Pesticides Plant in Vineland, N.J.
item.description: (New York, N.Y. – Sept. 28, 2016) The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency has finalized modifications to its plan to clean up contaminated exposed sediment in the Blackwater Branch floodplain at the Vineland Chemical Company Superfund site in Vineland, N.J.
item.dc:creator: Region 02
